casebody.data:
FORD MOTOR COMPANY, Appellant, v. PITTSBURGH STEAMSHIP COMPANY, Appellee. No. 10887. United States Court of Appeals Sixth Circuit. Oct. 13, 1948. Foster, Lott & Lutz, of Detroit, Mich., and Johnson, Branand & Jaeger, of Cleveland, Ohio, for appellant. McKeehan, Merrick, Arter & Stewart, of Cleveland, Ohio, for appellee.

Before ALLEN, MARTIN, and MILLER, Circuit Judges.

Per Curiam.

This appeal was heard upon the record, briefs and oral arguments of respective counsel; and it appearing to the .Court that the findings of fact of the District Court are supported by substantial evidence and are not clearly against the preponderance of the evidence; and that the Court’s conclusions of larw are not erroneous; it is ordered that'the decree of the District Court be and is affirmed.
